se分开+cure关心→不关心,不担忧→安全的
procure[v.[费心]取得,获得]+ment表名词→n.取得,获得
secure[adj.[from,against]安全的,放心的 v.得到;防护]+ity表名词→安全[证券同常有保障,所以有证券的意思]
pro前面+cure关心→关心在前→[想要]获得
se分开+cure关心→不关心,不担忧→安全的

means.word_mean: 担保人，保证人；保证金，抵押金(或物品)
保护物，使免受危险的东西

sentence.cn: 大公司可以减轻数据安全压力。

entry.def: Security refers to all the measures that are taken to protect a place, or to ensure that only people with permission enter it or leave it.
entry.tran: 防卫;保安措施;安全工作

example.ex: They are now under a great deal of pressure to tighten their airport security...
example.tran: 他们现在承受着加强机场安保措施的巨大压力。

example.ex: Strict security measures are in force in the capital.
example.tran: 首都采取了严密的安全措施。

entry.def: A feeling of security is a feeling of being safe and free from worry.

example.ex: He loves the security of a happy home life...
example.tran: 他喜欢幸福家庭生活所带来的安全感。

example.ex: If an alarm gives you that feeling of security, then it's worth carrying.
example.tran: 如果带着闹钟让你感到心里踏实，那就值得携带。

entry.def: If something is security for a loan, you promise to give that thing to the person who lends you money, if you fail to pay the money back.

example.ex: The central bank will provide special loans, and the banks will pledge the land as security.
example.tran: 中央银行会提供特殊贷款，而这些银行会以土地作为抵押。

entry.def: Securities are stocks, shares, bonds, or other certificates that you buy in order to earn regular interest from them or to sell them later for a profit.

example.ex: National banks can package their own mortgages and underwrite them as securities.
example.tran: 国家银行能够合并自己的抵押贷款并以证券形式包销。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being free from danger or injury;

sentences.sentence: "we support the armed services in the name of national security"

means.word_mean: 2. a formal declaration that documents a fact of relevance to finance and investment; the holder has a right to receive interest or dividends;
3. a department responsible for the security of the institution's property and workers;

sentences.sentence: "the head of security was a former policeman"

means.word_mean: 4. measures taken as a precaution against theft or espionage or sabotage etc.;

sentences.sentence: "military security has been stepped up since the recent uprising"

means.word_mean: 5. defense against financial failure; financial independence;

sentences.sentence: "his pension gave him security in his old age"
"insurance provided protection against loss of wages due to illness"
"the watch dog gave her a feeling of security"

means.word_mean: 7. an electrical device that sets off an alarm when someone tries to break in
8. property that your creditor can claim in case you default on your obligation;

sentences.sentence: "bankers are reluctant to lend without good security"

means.word_mean: 9. a guarantee that an obligation will be met

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French securite or Latin securitas, from securus 'free from care' (see secure)

sentences.cn: 国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。
sentences.en: National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.

Sentence.sentence: For most of us, letting go of the safety and security of the past gives us great fear.
The surge in world grain prices in 2007 and 2008—and the threat they pose to food security—has a different, more troubling quality than the increases of the past.
States fail when national governments can no longer provide personal security, food security and basic social services such as education and health care.
Rather than superpower conflict, countries unable to cope with food shortages now constitute the main threat to world security.
In the 20th century the main threat to international security was superpower conflict; today it is failing states.
In effect, our plan is the new security budget.
As the world's food security falls to pieces, individual countries acting in their own self-interest are actually worsening the troubles of many.
Wireless security providers will often take steps to help combat the threat of jamming attacks.

The team at Frontpoint addresses the issue in a blog on its site, citing their own jam protection software and claiming that there aren't any documented cases of successful jam attack since the company began offering wireless security sensors in the 1980s.
The odds of a criminal using technical means to bypass a security system are so small that the FBI doesn't even track those statistics.

That approach will eliminate most cord-cutting concerns—but what about their wireless equivalent, jamming? With the right device tuned to the right frequency, what's to stop a thief from jamming your setup and blocking that alert signal from ever reaching the base station?Jamming concerns are nothing new, and they're not unique to security systems.
Security devices are required to list the frequencies they broadcast on—that means that a potential thief can find what they need to know with minimal Googling.
Interfering with a wireless security system is similar to interfering with a conversation.
Different measures should be taken to protect one's home from burglary in addition to the wireless security system.

But how probable is it that someone will successfully jam their way into your home and steal your stuff?Let's imagine that you live in a small home with a wireless security setup that offers a functional anti-jamming system.
Burglars can easily get a security device's frequency by Internet search.
A burglar has to continuously jam the wireless security device to avoid triggering the alarm, both inside and outside the house.
At first, people were worried about security.
It doesn't mean greater job security for the employed.
There are 20 officers in the Campus Security Division Their job is to handle crime, accidents lost and found items ,and traffic problems on campus.

Defense minister Farhat Horchani said last week that German and American security experts were expected to come to help Tunisia devise a new electronic video-supervision system on its border with Libya.

I think it will be very interesting to see what etiquette (礼仪) emerges in terms of whether you tell people you have a camera or not, and whether guests have a right to ask that it be tuned off, if it's not a security issue.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C
